text: Best mango shaved ice I've tried! Me, my twin, and my friend shared and it was delicious. We ordered the mango shaved ice with matcha ice cream on top. I wanted to go here because of the rainbow latte, they didn't have all the colors for the latte so they offered green instead, my latte was good, the place has a nice ambience as well, might come back if I'm in the mood for bingsoo!

me and my dudes went here often on Saturday night and two girls are very sweet and nice. They are very friendly talking to us. I ordered a snow cake small but it looked like more than. So it was very worth to getting it. I wanna give 5 points out of 5!!!!! We always felt so welcomed! Makes me visit more often lol

Delicious shaved ice! A little on the pricey side, but not too bad if you split it with someone. We had the mango shaved ice and it was perfect for a hot Las Vegas day. The mango chunks are sweetened which was a nice surprise.
Great watermelon and mango snow cake in the hot weather!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Good for the hot weather!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

This place is cute and the shaved snow is pretty good but definitely not over the top. The employees there are rather cold and rude, however, not to mention the server tried to give us the wrong order 3 times. The employees alone are the reason we won't go back. It's just not good public relations when the cashier won't smile and just slams a bell down for us to ring when we're ready to order.

It is appalling that this place feels like they have the right and excuse to bribe people to give 5-star reviews. Their none-apologetic attitude perfectly illustrates their blatant and proven disregard for the customers. It's not surprising at all. I gave this place one star for its Mango Snow since it reminds us of home. All the money spent on the decor and the tasteless ice can not take away the fact that people who work there don't know or care anything about food, service or customers. I have been there several times reluctantly for my daughter and never once felt like they even attempted at the word-service. You will actually feel better if you can order the items by punching some buttons and not have to deal with the human beings that look like you are bothering them by ordering. This is also an over priced place for the small quantity and the quality you receive. Therefore, there is never a wait, even on the hottest day. That tells you something. This business should be jamming in the summer. You can not underestimate the importance of business management and customer service. Just because you think you have a product people want doesn't mean you should neglect the most important element of your business - the customers.

I'm visiting from NY and never had shaved ice. My friends and I were craving dessert and decided to try this place out. Definitely would go again! Mango shaved ice was so good and refreshing. Definitely would recommend for people who are dying in this Vegas heat
We tried their mango and greentea snow ice and both were so good. Def the best snow ice in town.
I loved their authentic rice cake in shaved ice! They also offer stumpton cold brew. Then ambient is quite adorable. A nice break from the busy main strip.

Love this place!  Mango Bingsoo and Lavender Iced tea = amazing.  Deidre was super nice and helpful!  One request  - Please add wintermelon/white gourd tea to the menu. 
Thank you!
I know this place is not coffee cafe but I would say coffee here is one thing you shouldn't order. By the way this place is very nice good service and good dessert :)
I expected better.  A little pricey, small portion, and not as good as other shaved snow places.  The ambiance and decoration are pretty good, but I rather have good price and good portion.

This place is so cool. The decor and music is more ambient than traditional cafes. the bing soo is shaved ice just like in korea. Think ice cream movies with a snow cone. the flavors are creative and tastes phenomenal. So happy I found this place

Best shaved ice in town!
It works well with popping pearls on top!
My kids love this place!

Called before I drove 30 minutes to come here to make sure they were open. When I arrived the girl that worked there said sorry we stopped serving snows 20 minutes ago. Super frustrating, ended up going to Snow flake shavery on spring mountain and it was awesome!
This is my favorite place for dessert. Very generous in size with good quality of food. I always get combination of strawberry and mango.
They have Stumptown coffee and nitro coffee as well.  Today we got their affogato with vanilla bean ice cream and caramel apple latte. Thumbs up!!

I love this place.  So good.  
Try their Strawberry Bingsoo and Chocolate Bingsoo.
Also they brewing Stumptown Coffee and cold brew.  I was not a big fan of coffee before I taste the Stumptown Coffee.  Oh my god.  Their coffee latte is super good.
Snow White is really premium dessert and coffee place.
i came here from los angeles to eat the shave ice with my family of 9 and they all love it. great shave ice and place to hang out defintely will come back here.

They have a fantastic nitro cold brew here.  It is served in a iced cold beer mug and the nitrogen creates a velvety foam head like a well poured Guinness.  Pair that with friendly table service and you got a loyal customer in me!

So why 2 stars?  I didn't get any of that today.  Maybe they're having an off day, but the lady at the counter tonight all but ruined my experience this visit.  Instead of the usual coffee nirvana, I got a small plastic to go cup (didn't bother to fill to the top either).  Instead of the warm table service I was expecting, she called me behind the register across the room like I'm in a cheap Chinese take-out... no "thank you", no eye contact, nada.

Well, the coffee went from chilled to room temp very quickly and I sat there feeling ripped off and wondered maybe that lady behind the counter is just having a bad day?  Last time I would visit on a Thursday night as the service were always fantastic during the day time.

Great place! the shave ice is different than most of the others. In my opinion, this tasted better. I would have giving it a 5 star and would have been here more if they offer smaller portion. Each of the shaved ice is about $11.00 and it's really for two people.

Price is high , almost same as my lunch !
When i went there no customer at all.
So quiet , kind embarrassed just out.
Too much ice also melted so quickly.
More toppings necessary, nothing special comparing other store.

Good, very good.   The ice cream is very good.  All the dessert is very good and the price is inexpensive.  We order the Mango & Watermelon shave ice to pair with Green Tea Tiramisu.  It was great on a hot summer day.
Looks like they are closed down.  There is a Matcha ice cream/desserts store moving in Spring 2018.  Looks pretty good.  Can't wait to try.
Taro milk tea with sea salt cream, cloud 9 cold brew coffee with cream cheese and milk tea cheese snow which is special order. All good. All thumbs up! My favorite cafe in Vegas!

The coffee was fantastic. Ambiance as well. The Hot Green Tea Latte is my favorite, 
I will probably update this post, as I need more experience at this place. So far not bad. Pricey slightly. The coffee actually tastes like Starbucks. In fact almost all the drinks here seem to be a copy of Starbucks. But not bad so far!

First time today. It was good. I ordered the mango and red bean snow dessert. It was really good. Generous with toppings. I dropped one star because the mango one is so sweet for me.. And the bottom part of the snow ice is slimy because of the sugar used. The red bean is the bomb! My hubby liked it too... Will go back for more to try different flavors of bingsoo and their specialty drinks... Recommended also. Just be prepared to pay 22$ for shaved snowy ice with toppings

We had tiramisu and mango shave ice. 
Both were very good. 
The tiramisu was topped with mascarpone and cocoa powder. It was not overly sweet. You must everything together to get the right taste. 
The mango shave ice topped with mago jam, grape fruit and green tea  ice cream. I loved their green tea ice cream.  The slush was soft and creamy. But I think the shave ice at class 302 is still better. 

My friend ordered matcha green tea slush which was very rich. I like ed it.

Great place to hang out. I like how they have a blocked out private area for groups. Nice interior design, just a little bit pricey on the shaved ice. Last time we ordered a mango shaved ice, and the mango is quite bad with very weird taste. I guess the mango season hasn't started yet.
Great place to hang out with friends at this sweet place. Try out their Tiramisu Snow... it's yummy

The interior decor is filled with snow white theme. Nice setup and friendly staff. Plenty of tables and seats. Great place to study. Ordered the green tea with a touch of sea salt. Highly recommend it :]
the workers are super friendly and there is a wide variety of cakes and milk teas! i've been here a couple of times and the shaved ice is always really good. i also love the aesthetics of the store.
5 stars for a spacious cool place to hangout. Dessert is better than the boba. Coffee mojito for a nice refresher.

Good service every time we come here. I love the snow flavors. They are very good at food presentation. 

Restrooms are clean and spacious. 

Tables are spaced too close together. Prices are good too.

When I enter Snow White Café, I feel a nice warm environment. The place is definitely clean and spacious. It isn't busy at the time, so I have an opportunity to ask how they work. They offer specialty snow cakes which are shaved ice dessert that comes with a selection of toppings such as fresh fruits, nuts, cereal, cookies, brownies, boba, and more. In addition, they serve espresso, signature lattes, nitro cold brew, lemonade, slush, create your own tea, and they make hot lava cake, pizookie, and waffle deserts. 

I went for the Design Your Own Snow ($9.95). My order is serve in a large chilled bronze bowl with plain snow, caramelized apple, sweetened red bean, lychee jelly, green rice cake, and it's topped with vanilla bean ice cream. Also they give extra cream on the side. This dessert taste amazing. I do enjoy the velvety texture of shaved ice and I love some of the toppings recommended to me by Vianey. She is the person who gave me great suggestions on what toppings will complement nicely in my bowl. I find that the sweetened red beans and lychee jelly pair up beautifully together with plain snow. Also the caramelized apple with vanilla bean ice cream has always been a delightful treat for me. And I wouldn't mind coming back to try other items on the menu.

Now there is ONE specific topping that I most likely will not go for. It's the green rice cake, also known as green tea mochi. Personally, I don't feel that mochi goes well with shaved ice. It is hard to chew and there is an aftertaste flavor as though it has been in the freezer for a very long time.

Came here on a Monday afternoon with a friend i had not seen in a while. Located between Spring Mountain and Desert Inn on Jones, it is a fairly popular area for food/drink/dessert. In the same shopping centre as the well known Q Karaoke and Icy Juicy, It is located on the northwest corner/end of the shopping centre. When I came here, parking was abundant, but from past experience, especially on a weekend, parking is much of an issue in this parking lot. 

It was occupied by only 1 table when we had came here, which soon left after we ordered (we didnt even notice they left... magic? ghost? Lol jk) 

Wide selection of beverages (that i didnt look into) and a small menu of Bingsoo (korean shaved ice dessert)

------------------------------------

Caramel Apple Bingoo ($11.95) - Homemade caramelized cinnamon apples, fresh apples, toasted pecans, ice cream

Fresh Strawberry Bingsoo ($10.95) - Homemade marinated strawberries, fresh strawberries, strawberry ice cream

Sweet Mango Bingsoo ($10.95) - Mango chunks, mango ice cream

Chocolate Brownie Bingsoo ($10.95) - Brownie chunks, french cocoa powder, chocolate swirl wafers, coconut flakes, chocolate ice cream

Roasted Soybean Bingsoo ($9.95) - Roasted soybean powder, sweetened red bean, sliced almonds, rice cake, vanilla ice cream

Redbean Bingsoo ($8.95) - Sweetened red bean, petite rice cakes, vanilla ice cream

Crunch Oreo Bingsoo ($8.95) - Oreo crumbs, vanilla ice cream

------------------------------------

Because i had recently came back from my trip to Korea, i have been craving for some korean bingsoo (specifically Sulbing). In korea at Sulbing, the roasted soybean bingsoo was their "traditional version". I remember recongizing the soybean powder from the korean drama series, The Heirs, and always wanted to try it. Lol (SHHH) 

We had picked the roasted soybean bingsoo to try. Apparently there was a pick up window but had not realized. One of the workers there had brought it to our table. Oops? XD Good service at least? Lol 

As mentioned previously, shaved ice topped with sweetened red bean, sliced almonds, rice cake, roasted soybean powder, and VANILLA? ice cream. Reason why i said VANILLA? was because it was definitely not the traditional vanilla. Though i couldn't really tell what flavor it was, it was a slight brownish color. I'd almost call it borderline soybean powder ice cream. Lol It was delicious at least? Rice cake was soft and chewy. Sweetened red bean was not mushy but fairly firm to the bite, which was surprising and nice. Oh, also a small pouring cup of condensed milk which was fun to drizzle over everything. Hehe :P Whats nice is its not just a pile of ice, but like a small pile, some powder, then more ice. Attention to detail right? Lol 

Unfortunately, unlike Sulbing in korea, the shaved ice was not shaved milk. :( sad face. Overall, it was still very tasty and would love to come and try the other ones! Mango and strawberry looks delicious. Hopefully the place will last and be more known. Noticed the hours, it doesnt open that late. Might be a bad thing but if their product is good, they'll still get the business (hopefully).

We tried tiramisu and snow white latte with cinnamon which are really great and tasty. Moreover we really like the athmosphere which is relaxing and stylish. Service was great too. Definitely we will come back. Thank you guys
I usually go to LA for my bingsoo fix but this time I happen to be in Vegas area. This place definitely does not disappoint ! Loved it ! Great service , great ambiance, and fabulous dessert!

Love the option to build your own. In So Korea where I had my first bingsu you're stuck w whatever each store serves. Today was vanilla bean icecream, Oreo, fresh strawberries & marshmallows. My first cold treat this year for a warm day. Try them you'll like it and less calories...

This is a somewhat regular hangout spot for my church. It's a cute little spot with a good variety of drinks and dessert. Usually there are tables we can push together to make a larger table for our fairly large groups. I'm sure they're usually busier at night so a large group would probably not be ideal, but you could probably hang out outside if anything. Most of their drinks and desserts can easily be taken to go.

I've had their green tea snow, and I have mixed reviews for it. The first time, the matcha or something was extremely bitter, and no matter how much of the condensed milk we put on it, it was still bitter. Bad first experience. But today, I had it again, and it tasted way better! Much more subtle, and not too sweet at all.

I've also had the lychee iced tea, which was... okay. From the overall consensus of my church people, it seems like most of the drinks seem pretty good. I think the cold brew is what they're known for, but I can't attest to it, since I've never personally tried it.

Figured I'd grab dessert here with my kids since we were already eating at a nearby restaurant and it was 100+degrees.   The decor is modern-rustic and just a teeny tiny touch if Disney, you'd miss it if you blinked, but it was perfectly decorated.   We ordered the Strawberry Dessert and the Chocolate Brownie Dessert.  Both came to the table and my first thought was,"are you serious? $15 for ice and fruit".  But as we started eating the 'snow' started melting, the creamy ice cream and fresh fruit and chocolate started merging and it was simply a delicious and delightful experience! How did someone even think to do that?   2 people can easily share a dessert and I plan on coming back and bringing people to surprise!   I didn't try any of the coffees on the menu, but there's always next time.

I like the ambience and the cleanliness. Customer service is great and our snow desserts came out very fast. I got the chocolate brownie snow and it was very good. I've never had such a unique dessert and I enjoyed it. Overall it was a great experience.

This place is amazing! The cafe itself is set up super cute with nice lights and decoration. The cashier lady was very friendly and helpful. She told us about the drinks and desserts and recommended which add ons to get. We got taro milk teas, Nutella milk tea and a sea salt caramel. All were AMAZING! But the sea salt was my favorite. I highly recommend this cafe. Beautiful ambiance, great and friendly customer service and good drinks! Will definitely come back for the desserts and shaved ice.

$10+ for shaved ice? Seems unreasonable... But  presentation and ambience great, the staff greater , patient in explaining what's it all about the hype but the greatest is the  green tea concoction which you can share ...So try it out

Their snow cakes are the best in town. Love this place alot! Highly recommend!
 Come here and try to design your own snow. You would love it!

Heard a new dessert place opened in town so decided to give it a try on a Thursday night. I'm in love with their decor and how much effort they put into this store. They have extremely clean and cute bathrooms too! I tried their affogato with sea salt caramel ice cream and I only liked the ice cream . . the coffee was too strong for my taste. I also tried their Stumptown nitro cold brew, which was awful. Again, too strong for my liking. The parking situation is always a shit show. I heard their shaved ice is good so I'll probably give this place one last shot in the future.
Very good place for coffee, tea , desert . Very clean and the employees very friendly. This is my wife's favor place now. So we are coming back soon
This place is fire. Straight fire. Muy fuego!!! Every time I visit Vegas, I have to stop by here. Their snows are just too good. Definitely my go to spot
Awesome dessert and drinks! Try the popular tiramisu snow! Atmosphere is comfortable and staff is friendly and helpful. Fast service too!

Sadly this will be the last time I check in here. This has been my family and mine spot for about 9 months now. Recently the staff and recipes have changed. Neither for the better. The staff now is incredibly rude and has no customer service. We will be very sad to not come back here anymore.

I've been waiting for Snow White to open since their signage went up months ago- great location, few competing coffee options in the area, and several nearby restaurants to provide traffic for after-dinner desserts!

Snow White is one of a growing number of local spots to use Stumptown coffee. They offer the brew every way you can imagine, from affogato to cold brew and even the nitro cold brew (holy caffeine overload!). Selection of flavored lattes includes options like rose (subtle but sweet!), matcha (non-espresso!), and they also offer a bunch of teas. Have yet to try the desserts, but portions are huge for sharing.

The decor is perfect- shades of white and grey on the walls, tables, and floor give subtle nod to the name, along with cute decorative touches. Lee is as sweet as the namesake princess, ask her for recommendations when you go!

EDIT: Went back for dessert and tried their Strawberry Bingsoo. Huge portions, fresh fruit, natural flavors, and fluffy ice! Will have to try the mango or brownie flavor next.
My favorite dessert spot. The tiramisu snow cake is delicious. Also there teas are great, particularly the peach green tea

Super relaxing chill place. Have a sweet tooth? SNOW WHITE IT IS.

There arrangement for the food is really aesthetic and looks almost too appealing to eat.

Let's just hope it taste as good as it looks

this place is addicting. i had to update review. 
the portions are bigger now. thank you
Such a cute Cafe , reminds me of a little Cafe in Disneyland . Very affordable and the perfect portions ! The sea salt cream is so delicious it is a bit on the sweeter side but not complaining !

We had a buss pass, therefore, this is another place that we hit up with the said pass during our stay in Vegas that is another place way off the Strip. I had the strawberry cream shaved ice with the strawberry bubble tea for two. The inside is very clean and sleek. The service was fast. Normally I have to wait for a long time in Richmond, BC for shaved ice. There was some wait but these guys were more efficient when it came to handling the orders. Prices were very reasonable.
Great environment and people. I love the selection of coffee and deserts. Must try and it is open late. I tried their lovely Green Tea, great flavor.

What a wonderful spot! I love the decor and the coffee was amazing!  Next time I must try the snow!!!  We had just come from baskin Robbins across the street. Wish I would have seen this spot first!  It looks and sounds amazing. Very friendly staff. Will return next time we are in Vegas!

Whoa. This place was definitely something else. The moment I stepped in I felt like I was in a new world. I've never had an experience like it. The shaved ice is very yummy and I've never anything like it anywhere else before. Eating snow as a kid has always been a pleasant memory of mine and now there is a place where I can do it any time, and with additional flavors too! 

The cold brew is the best cold brew out of any other place in Vegas. My opinion.

Staff is great is genuinely friendly and very professional.

I have to say the interior decoration is super cute and relaxing. This is definitely be a cute place to go on a first date! 

My friend and I ordered a small strawberry ice and a lavender white latte to share since we were both still full. Before ordering the lavender White we were both curious to see what was the difference between the lavender white latte and lavender white mocha. We asked the person ringing us up however he couldn't tell us the difference because he was pretty clueless himself.
UM WHAT ? How do you not know your menu and you work there? 
The ice arrived super fast however they got our latte wrong. Instead of the lavender they made us a vanilla latte but since we weren't picky we decided to go with the vanilla. The worker said she could add lavender syrup to the coffee so we just went with that option.

The ice was unflavored and the topping was way too sweet for me ( strawberry jam). However it balanced nicely with the unflavored ice but I much rather preferred actual strawberry flavored ice.
Latte was disappointing, we barely tasted the lavender flavoring.

Overall I didn't have high hopes for this place and I'm glad I didn't or else I would be so disappointed. Perhaps I'll come here again if I really want unflavored ice.

My friends and I came to this cafe to get some cold desserts after a hot afternoon. When I first walked in, I fell in love with the design of this place! It's so cute and unique compared to other boba and shaved snow places I've been to. 

I was glad they had a small shaved snow option ($6) because we were all full from lunch. The small portion is a decent size. I think I would normally get a small portion. There's also a large portion that costs $10. If you want to customize your shaved snow, you have to order the large. 

I ordered the green tea while my friends ordered the tiramisu and the chocolate brownie. I really liked the red bean and the almond pieces on the green tea. I was actually really excited about the rice cake topping. I think the rice cake was covered in soy powder, and that made the rice cake really salty. That was jarring, and it didn't mesh well with the dessert. The shaved snow isn't really sweet, and the rice cake is too salty in comparison. The shaved snow itself was very light and airy. It actually resembles the texture of real snow.

I prefer my shaved ice to be creamier (similar to ice cream) and sweeter (where's the condense milk?), which makes me less likely to come here. On the otherhand, if you like your dessert to be less sweet and airy, Snow White is the place for you (my friends reaaaaalIy liked this place).
This place is amazing , we come very often with the whole family.. my daughter was the first to find it and when she brought us i fell inlove with the consistency of the snow tiramisu and the boba!

1st time here ordered a small snow cake with mango and grapefruit. I was under the impression that a snow cake was just like a snow cone, but this was not water based, this was more like a shaved cream. It was delightful. Had I known this was cream based, I would have gone with a different topping, however this was still quite delicious. This place is great especially on a hot summer-triple-digit weather kind of day.
It's magical. You want a wow factor. You'll find it here. Amazing. Definitely a must visit for an over the the top dessert.

The Goods
1. Korean style shave ice milk!  So many choices and all so good! 
2. Also does soda and coffee iced coffee

Service 
1. Friendly and smiley love it
2. CC and cash ok
3. Parking can be packed but during peak times 

Ambiance 
1. Cute esp the bathroom, might wanna check it out
2. Feels like a little dwarf dwelling with little figurines, feels cozy 

MoJo
1. Get the tiramisu, and matcha azuki!!  
2. Go here to catch up with friends

I had the snow mango with a side of condensed milk.  Let me say, the condensed milk was runny, meaning they probably watered it down.  If you're cheap enough to do that, that means quality
means nothing to you. The service was okay and nothing spectacular. The snow mango was okay. For $7 it wasn't a great portion and it tasted like shaved ice with a bit of cream and bits of mangoes on top. The mangoes were ripe and good, I wish it was richer and sweeter. My friend ordered a drink and they got it wrong, it didn't taste great either.  I think the presentation is what you're paying for, the flavor lacks in what we had.

In the world of shave ice here at Snow White Cafe takes on unique twist. The ice is shaved more fine then the 808 style that grew up on in life. It not only the way they cut the ice but the presentation is truly artwork. Not only from eye appeal, details (the  bowl they serve the ice is chilled chilled) from the bowl served in, the tray, the sauce that pour over the top, and kind of scared break it all down. Not just the food I really like the interior got the whole snow white concept going on with the mirror, and the vibe of the place very laid back very chill spot. 

It was my first time but thankfully came with Suzy H not her first time. So explained me the way it all works. The size got the large bowl, It might look like lot recommended for two. You really could eat the whole thing. It only ice. Lol. The green tea ice cream on top!! Unreal good! I  could have had whole bowl of it. Then you add the shave ice then topped with some adzuki beans reminded me pounding mochi on new years and filled some with adzuki beans. Onolicous!!! The mochi rectangle or pieces around the top perfect compliment. If fan of all things green tea this bowl brings out the best and the color is green green more green. I really look forward trying more of the shaved ice. 

I also notice Lychee smoothie on the menu. Different or never had smoothie that flavor. I was impressed. It had nice strong fresh lychee flavor, nice blended slushy like smoothie, and not over sweet. They also serve coffee, pastries, and refrigeration section of drinks. If looking for place small, quiet, chill environment, and great shave ice or looking relax with coffee great book or great conversations with friends. Snow White Cafe is great spot!*!*!*

The mango shaved ice here is probably one of the best one I found in Las Vegas. Since I had ice monster in Taiwan, I didn't think any ice dessert would come closed to it. But I have to say that this place did. I have try the strawberry  and the brownies ice. Both were good but my favorite is mango. The last 4 time I been here they been running out of the green tea ice so I'm looking forward to try that out!!! Highly recommended

The decor is clean and rustic. The restrooms are clean, very impressive. The only Snow White theme about the store is the name of the drinks. I wasn't impressed with the drinks because it was all ice, barely any beverage in the cup. Not worth it for the price. There was only 1 staff member working that night, wasn't too busy for a weekend but overall friendly staff.

Came here on a Sunday afternoon with my family (4 of us total) and it wasn't too busy at all. The inside is really clean and cutely decorated with Snow White themed paintings/ mirrors all throughout the store (even in the bathroom!) 

We got a couple of large bingsoos ($9.95 for each) : one was the standard mango one and the other one was a custom one we asked for! For the custom one, you get a choice of a sauce, 3 toppings, cereal toppings, and a scoop of ice cream! We got mango sauce, mangos, strawberries, and red bean, fruit pebbles and vanilla ice cream and it was DELICIOUS! The fruity pebbles  add a nice crunch, might be a little overpowering of the other flavors at times but they don't throw on too much so all good. Each bingsoo comes with a little side of condensed milk so don't worry if you don't see it on the menu, you will get some! 

Also ps they no longer have the green tea available for the ice, only have the plain flavor now!
We had the strawberry shaved ice and my kids loved it.  As for myself, I'm not a fan of sweets all that much; however I took a tastes and it tasted good.  It was not overpowering sweet.

Was looking for a light and refreshing dessert, and Snow White was right next to the restaurant we had dinner at. It's cute and spacious inside the shop. 

The girl who helped us wasn't actually listening to our questions and was looking at her phone while we looked at the menu. We asked what she thought about the tiramisu flavor and she instead went on to list the most popular toppings. What? It happened again when I asked whether my face had to be in the picture in order to get the free tea they were offering with the Yelp review. I didn't even bother doing it because I never got a straight answer. Something about how they check ID? And in that case, why do I need to have my face in the Yelp review? Idk. 

We got the large snow with strawberries, mangoes, and vanilla ice cream. It came with a side of condensed milk. I felt as though $10 was pretty pricey for just fruits, syrup, and snow with one ice cream scoop. The fruits were on the sour side too, with the mangoes being chewy (not ripe) rather than soft. We were told that the small size doesn't come with ice cream, but you could add it for $2. Again, really pricey imo for a single scoop of ice cream if you decide to get a small, since the small is $6 and after ice cream it's $8, so you might as well buy a large anyway. 

Presentation was nice but I honestly wouldn't go out of my way to come here. Snow is just meh and you can get Stumptown coffee at Whole Foods.

EDIT: almost immediately after posting the owners addressed the issue and offered a free drink to try and compensate. I tried the matcha latte a little less sweet. They said it's a little difficult to alter the sweetness due to the powder being already pre-sweetened but would try making it with a little less powder.

The second drink was not bad, a lot better than my original, still slightly a little sweet but much better.
They said they would note the previous mentions in my first review. Although the sweetness was still a little more than I usually prefer, the service in addressing the issue makes up for it a lot.

Service is 80% of a business success imo, and the readdress was very much appreciated and gave me a change of heart.

They also gave us free ice cream as well, it really shows they care about their business and satisfaction for their customers.

**********************

You can taste heart, and my drink is as heart less as Kanye west to paparazzi.

I got the mint mojito, a favorite of mine but I just felt extremely disappointed.
First things first, I really dislike when people give you 3/4 ice in a coffee drink. Number one, it dilutes the drink, and number two it's just plain cheap.

The mint mojito here at Snow White is just mint pieces tossed in ice and plain watered down coffee.
The premature coffee beans made the brew taste super sour when I wanted an earthy and fruity sweet minty freshness. The mint was practically absent and chopped into large pieces.

If they had muddled the mint more instead of quickly a few careless chops, the mint flavor would be more present and complimentary. Also please please use coffee beans that aren't prematurely picked!!! I can't stand sour coffee, like unbearably sour coffee. I can handle lemons but this was just plain depressing.

Also maybe a little cream or half and half or anything would be nice, even if they could just put it over on the counter so I could pour it in self serve style would be nice. The only option I had available though was 4 options of sugar. I didn't even see napkins on the side counter, it felt like a waste of space.

The only redeeming quality though was the clean and tastefully themed Alice in wonder land theme, +1 star.
I may considering changing my review if I can find a redeeming drink, but this is the second time their item had disappointed me.

I just don't ever see myself saying "hey let's get Snow White you guys!" Which presents my 2 star rating.
Also lately, it would be nice to have a warm welcome in the cafe. They weren't rude but more like.. how should I say? ..uninterested.

No, "hello" or "welcome.." just "what do you want to order?"

Uhh okay, straight to the point I guess. But still it also made me not want to ask for any recommendations for fear their suggestion might be as cold as their greeting. Maybe next time I come by again i'll see if they've improved any and change my review, but for now. It's a 2 of 5 for me. Aka a big fat: "MEHHHHHHHH"
Perfect dessert spot.  Shaved ice is so light and fluffy.  Decor is cute and interior is so spacious for large groups.  Large selection is also a plus.
Snow White was decently priced and definitely tasty!!! We tried the Oreo shaved ice and it was enough to fill 3 of us. Plus the workers were incredibly friendly.

First time here and it was a big disappointment. Silverware was dirty, I asked to get another spoon politely and she threw an attitude. Desserts weren't all that great, and our drinks were watery. Customer service was horrible. DEFINITELY NOT WORTH THE HYPE.

BEST snowflakes store in VEGAS ever!!!
The owner is super attentive and friendly, the "Green Tea" she recommended is amazing!!! You have to try! LOVE IT!

The inside of this little cafe is really well done. The tile on the floor is great, the tables and chairs are plentiful and the windows let in a lot of light. They serve Stumptown Coffee, but the shaved ice is the real star of the show here. Unlike most other shaved ice places Snow White uses plain ice and uses all the toppings to sweeten it up. Most places have flavored ice, from my experience, but here it's all about the toppings. I got a brownie sundae dish and really enjoyed it. The shaved ice was drizzled with sweetened condensed milk, dusted with cocoa powder and then topped with brownie pieces and cookies. The milk and cocoa powder made the shaved ice taste just like chocolate ice cream. The brownies tasted fresh and the cookies added a good crunch. I was very happy. I don't think I spoke until it was finished, I just kept eating. If you like shaved ice you should definitely try this spot out. They're doing some creative and different things here.
this place is the cutest! the theme of this place is just grand! and the snow is my fav. also the boba is great too! i recommend
Top kek place. Great for tea/coffee as well as their signature shaved ice stuff. I come here often after dinner. Its conveniently located in Chinatown near lots of nice places

The snow cakes are a perfect dessert if you're ever in the mood for something sweet. The snow cakes have a fluffy texture between shaved ice and shaved snow. It's soft and melts in your mouth. It's sweet and you can add your own toppings such as fruit syrup, fruits, and cereal. You can also add a scoop of ice cream if you decide to order the large size.

The prices are a bit more expensive than Snowflake. A small snow cake costs $5.95 and a large costs $9.95. For this price you can get a large size at Snowflake. The only difference is you will get shaved snow at Snowflake and here at Snow White Cafe you get "bingsu" (Korean shaved ice with condensed milk mixed in). There is a slight difference between the two, but you can always add condensed milk to your shaved snow as a topping and you essentially have the same thing.

Parking can be difficult especially if you're coming at peak hours because it's located in the same plaza as District One and the karaoke bar. 

The comments have all been deactivated off their yelp page for now because they were offering rewards to guests who wrote them a five star review. Honestly, there are many other businesses that have done the same in Las Vegas but haven't been reported. I don't know when they'll be back up again, but I'm sure their reputation was harmed because of this.

Honestly not impressed with the drinks here. Tried two drinks... Jasmine green tea and a Coffee Float with espresso ice cream. Jasmine green tea lacked flavor, didn't taste any hint of jasmine. Was super excited to try the coffee float but such a disappointment. Paid $8 for about 4 oz of drink... Took two sips and decided it wasn't my cup of tea. Would probably return to try their dessert menu but definitely no more drinks for me!

10/10 recommend this place! 

The entire place is perfect to meet up with your friends and catch up and eat some dessert together. We ordered the mango + watermelon snow cake and it was amazing! Apparently it is seasonal-- so get it while you can.

I was recommended this place by a friend so I decided to give it a try. Walking in, I was impressed by the interior and the cleanliness of the place, but that's not what I came for. I got a small oreo snow, small mango snow, and a large almond milk tea. They completely forgot about my almond milk tea and I was already halfway done with my snow before I had to go ask them about it. When they gave me my milk tea with boba, I was unsatisfied to find that their boba isn't fresh. It was hard and very cold. It must have been sitting for 2+ hours. 
Overall, their shaved ice is average, nothing too exciting.

Now this place is an indulgence! Personally, much better than Serenade. I know these two places are pretty hyped up...but Snow White Café takes the cake.

This past Saturday night was my first time trying shaved ice. This is not your typical county fair crunch shaved ice drizzled in overly sweet artificial colored syrup. This was literally a soft, fluffy, melts in your mouth kind of dessert. We got both small cups of tiramisu and oreo.

Décor was pretty. I know when you think of Snow White, you're thinking of all things pink, girly and/or Disney. Nope...nothing like that here. Very rustic, country-esque décor. Athmosphere was chill. Parking can be difficult since it's located in a popular plaza. Be careful with the Asian drivers lol. I definitely will come back to try different shaved ice flavors and their beverages....like the caramel apple latte or the lychee iced tea. Very extensive menu. This is perfect for date nights and those summer nights.
came here in a Saturday afternoon, nice and chill, great decor.. We have the soybean snow cake wjich is pretty good.. Would come back and try some other flavors.

Good quality, spacious, clean, well lit with windows, calm music, but only the secluded corner area has electrical plugs that work. I would rerun for the drinks and socializing. However, it's not for studying if electronics are being used, or if it's like my situation where my phone needed a quick charge.

I have been meaning to try this place for a while. Unfortunately, when I stopped in at 3:30 pm on a Friday, the door was propped open but the place was completely empty. I mean NOBODY was there. I walked up to the counter yelled hello- nothing. 

On to the next place, I guess.
Really good korean snow  shaved ice and really nice. The insides are clean and the interior is spectacular the taste is spectacular as well
First off, whoever did the decor in this place needs to do my house for me. Love it. The drinks and desserts are awesome and very unique. My favorite is the green tea tiramsu snow ice. Must try!

Love LOVE love this place! After getting a massage, we bumped into this place by accident and it was a great thing. The staff is always super nice. My favorites on the drink side is the lavender milk tea and if you're there I definitely suggest trying their snows. My fave is the tiramisu. It just melts in your mouth. If you have a sweet tooth and have never experienced trying one, I definitely recommend stopping in. They have lots of drink choices and snow selections.

This place is right in the heart of China Town. Probably one of the busiest little plazas so yes parking challenges is to be expected. My coffee lover and I strolled in an hour after it opened. Although the snow ice looked delicious we came in here for business. The barista made me a nice white lavender latte. Suuuupper aromatic. It was sweet but not too much. Just the perfect amount of foam with a cute heart design. My bf got the mint mojito drink. A nice icy cold brew refresher for the day on the sweet side but still good. We sat in the back corner, nice decor plugs everywhere so you can spread out. Loud music for when you're trying to get work done but overall a good place to hang out for a few hours. Plenty of things on the menu that I still want to try.

Went here to get dessert and gotten the green tea bingsoo with green tea ice cream, red beans, lychee jelly and mango, it also came with condense milk. The dessert looks cool when it came out and it was a pretty good portion for large (it can feed 2 ppl :P). The decor for this place is nice too, so I feel that you pay the price for the decor, lol, it's pretty expensive for just snow ice/ ice cream, I think it was $12 for the large.
Also, the texture of this snow ice is like actual snow because of the machine that they have, so that's pretty cool.
Nice ambiance. Snow dessert is very fine and melts in your mouth. Not too sweet which is good

We're here to have ice cream and shave ice. The ones we ordered: RedBean shave ice; RedBean Ice cream; and Strawberry Ice cream all tasty and delicious. All costed between 9 and 10 dollars. Decent setting and nice service.
I took myself out for Valentine's dinner and skipped  dinner just so I could have dessert here. Staff is so friendly and I haven't ever gotten anything I didn't like.

Snow White-- a name that will draw people in who love Disney. Interior was decorated in a fantasy way which was awesome! I ordered the Oreo Snow. Came with shaved ice, Oreo crumblings, condensed milk and tiny bits of brownies. It's nice for a hot sunny day and to sit with friends and just talk! I didn't try out the other flavors but I'll go back and try them. The portion is BIG as well. You can share this between 2-3 people!
The tiramisu shaved ice is soooooo good!!!!!!!! It the best snow ice I've ever tasted
this place has one of the best and softest shaved ice!!! definitely coming again!!! the atmosphere is so nice :)

wow. such a let down. i was excited to try this place out, but it's not what i thought it was gonna be. first off, no boba. then, i ordered a almond milk tea yet it tasted like cherry. what's up with that? then my friend's Nutella milk tea didn't taste like that at all. my stomach now feels yucky. my friend's been in the bathroom for an hour. really disappointed. will not return. the place is cute though. like simon cowell once said, it's a no for me.

This is now one of my new favorite coffee shops! The decor and theme is so cute, and the drinks are amazing! I got an iced caramel apple latte, and my mom got a mint mojito! We will be back, that's forsure!

I really enjoy this place. We come here to study sometimes and it never disappoints. Parking can be a little difficult... depending on the time you go so be aware and patient. 

The decor is really amazing. It fits the name perfectly and is themed in a really tasteful way... the lighting is also pretty great for studying. 

They offer a full variety of different coffees, teas, and lattes. Our favorite is the lavender with almond milk. I definitely recommend! They also supply stumptown nitro cold brew coffee!! It's one of my favorite brands. I recommend trying the pressed loose leaf tea as well. It is absolutely amazing... and their flavors are on point. 

They offer a variety of different Snow bingsoos. I haven't been able to try any of them... none of them are vegan. They all look good though. I hope one day they do start accommodating the non dairy and vegan population! Definitely give this place a try.

The Snow White Cafe is located in the same plaza as District One, Q Bistro, Hachi, and Icy Juicy. 
From what one could already expect, the theme of the café is quite magical with more than enough seating.
My sister and I always came here after dinner, ordering their Oreo or green tea bingsoo. The shaved ice comes in two sizes, but we're so wild and order a large one for each of us. The bowls also come with a little container of condensed milk, and the sweet employee warned us not to pour the whole thing in or it's going to be too sweet. 

Plot twist: We wanted more condensed milk.

I also ordered a rose latte before with latte art. It was very good.
Seriously, the bingsoo is to die for. I am looking forward to it soon.

So glad we stopped by!! The drinks are so delicious and refreshing. Hubby had the poisonous apple and I'm sipping a lavender latte. We just had lunch so we'll not be partaking in any snow or other desserts but we will definitely be coming back!

I love this new discovery! I grew up with snow cones from Hawaii, but this tastes very different. It's super light, just like snow! The tiramisu is my favorite and my son enjoys the crunch Oreos. This is our second day in a row-very addicting! Cute decor and friendly staff too.
Delicious! Perfect for hot Vegas summer days. Nicely decorated interior...a perfect setting to relax and socialize. Would come back again. I recommend getting the build your own snow.
I love this place! Delicious! Try Mango and strawberry and tiramisu! Bring your whole family

I absolutely love this cafe! I'm so excited to be writing this review because of my visit here with my siblings. We were supposed to try a new dessert place after having dinner at the Chinatown Plaza, but that particular establishment only accepted cash. Not a good way to start earning business if you've just opened up. So, my siblings suggested going to Snow White Cafe. Plus, it was very close to where we were.

I'm glad they mentioned it! I really enjoyed their Tiramisu Snowflake dessert (Bingsoo), as well as the Oreo one. Both were not too sweet and had a great mix of light, sugary flavors. Especially the Tiramisu! I could have eaten the large one all by myself. That's how much I enjoyed it! Good till the last bite. They offer it in a small or large size, and you can even build your own bingsoo.

As for the drinks, my sis ordered a Taro Milk Tea with boba. She said it was really good and the boba was really soft. One of the girls working behind the counter said she added extra, since it was near closing time. So nice! I didn't get a drink, but I'm saving it for when I come back. :]

The decor and space of this establishment sets it apart from other small time cafes that I've been to. They have plenty of tables and chairs, and the decor throughout the entire place gives it a charming, clean look. There is also one seating area, towards the back, that is separated by a wall. This is where they keep a longer table, which is perfect for a big group of people. Plus, it's a more secluded spot. 

This business sits at the very corner of the Mountain View Plaza. Can't miss it. However, parking can be a problem when coming here at night or on the weekends. This plaza can get very busy, since many of the eateries around the area are open really late.

For sure, I will be a regular here. You might catch me chillin at this place when I'm on one of my dessert runs! lol Just wish they open a lil bit later for us night owls. :]

My new favorite dessert spot in Chinatown LV. Been waiting anxiously for this location to open across the street. So excited when the open sign came on. They spent a ton of money decorating  and spared no detail. The bathroom is even amazing. Chose the Oreo Bingsoo and I'm addicted. Can't wait to try the other flavors. Staff was really friendly. Brush up on the social media and geo tagging guys. A lot of people will want to find this place and not get mixed up with other concepts that have "snow" in the name.

Nice place to sit in and catch up with old friends. Interior decor was cute and simple. Also, I love how the music wasn't too loud unlike other cafes or dessert places. We had the mango snow ice and it was great. It wasn't too sweet , which I like. it's good enough to share with 4-5 people. Oh the lavender latte is a must try! I'll definitely come back.

They did ,however, forget my friend's drink..but they were nice enough to give her a refund and still serve her her drink. && complimented us with free macaroons. They sure know how to win back their customers lol

Love their coffee, way better than Starbucks
Plus highly recommend taro n coconut milk tea.
Never tried any snow yet but they look very nice!!!
Super good n tasty, good service awesome tiramisu snow ice... come one come all, everybody wins

Upscale dessert.  If you see anywhere it says 'Premium Snow' just expect to pay more than $10 for flavored shaved ice.  Well they pull this kinda deal at the movie theaters too - holes in your pocket... 

Otherwise it's a cute place with the decor and all.  Good job designers!  Very cafe like atmosphere.  Boba drinks were okay.  They have lavender - good flavor.  Price to size comparison; I can find better elsewhere.

Parking may be a hassle, depending on the day.  It's in a plaza with popular restaurants.  Seriously the lot is not big enough; however not their fault.  

Little daughters will love this place though, especially with the name.  Fancy snow at Snow White.  Just cute!

The ambiance is really charming and clean, but I wasn't totally impressed with the desserts we got. I tried the Green Tea Bingsoo with Red Bean  and Green Tea ice cream. Mine was pretty good, but not $10.95 good. For goodness sake, it's 80% shaved ice. My friend got their Apple Pie Bingsoo, which was bland. I felt bad that he paid $12 for a flavorless cup of ice with a sprinkling of caramel apple and fresh apple toppings.

Easy to find.  We had driven pass this place several times and finally decided to stop and grab some dessert. I'm glad we did.  We got the mango bowl dessert.  It's a combination of shave ice hence the Snow White, small small scoop of ice cream and mangos with a sweet syrup served on the side.  It was very tasty and cool for an especially hot summer.   Would have given it a 5 star except the ice cream scoop was too small for. $11 dessert.

This cool and nice atmosphere makes this a great spot to relax and hangout at in the summer. We got the chocolate brownie and grapefruit mango! The chocolate one has chunks of brownies, chocolate cheerios, and rolled cookies. The fruits are fresh and is sweet and tangy. My tastebuds exploded. Super refreshing!
One of my favorite dessert places in Las Vegas. Very nice ambient and quiet place to hang out
They have best shaved ice in Las Vegas. You should try Chocolate Brownie Shaved ice (Bingsoo). Lavender Latte is amazing that you should try it.

I love Snow White! I come here a lot with my friends because the location is so convenient. My favorite is the milk tea cheese snow shaved ice because it's really unique and the taste is flavorful. I also love the strawberry and mango one. The ice is super fluffy and soft! Perfect for a hot day in Vegas!
Yummy strawberry slushee on a hot day.  Customer service was quick and offered free drink as well!
My family and I love this place. Our favorite is the strawberry ice. A must try!!! Don't believe try it!! You won't regret!!!
This place was differently worth it. We got a large snow cake in brownie flavor. It was large enough to fit 4 people.

Love this place. Decor is very nice as well as the music. I've tried both the poisonous apple and mirror mirror on the wall teas, both were great. Staff has always been helpful every time I've been here. Wish it wasn't so far from me!

I absolutely love the different flavors of snow cakes here! So far I've tried the tiramisu, caramel apple, mango, strawberry, green tea, and milk tea cheese snow. My favorite is the caramel apple, but I replaced the pecans with mochi. The cheese snow is a bit on the saltier side (obviously), but it's still very enjoyable. This is such a good place to come late at night if you're craving snow cakes! It's in a good location with other great places for entertainment and food!
Great spot to hang out with friends in the hot Las Vegas heat! Staff is polite and friendly and I'm never disappointed with any of the selections. I have a major sweet tooth.

We stumbled upon this place when my bf wanted something sweet after a nice spicy dinner at the same area. It's located in a strip mall on Jones with a ton of other great foodie spots we love.

The atmosphere is inviting, spacious than most boba drinks place and have this cozy and charming storylike feel. I like the tables made marble like.

What's unique about this place is that the snow is not flavored. They pack it with a lot of different things and the ice is shaved very finely.

They offer different snow cream desserts, coffees, teas and more. I had Lychee green tea and my bf had 'Snow in the desert.' The flavors were both delicious. We just had lunch that day so we didn't have room for any snow or other desserts but we will definitely be coming back!

This place is perfect. From the "snow ice cream" concept to decor to the fact that they serve Stumptown coffee. Discovered it randomly after nearby ramen and was completely delighted. Everything here was done perfectly.

BEST BINGSOO IN TOWN! I absolutely love this place! I always go after I go to Chubby Cattle! This complex is amazing! Right after karaoke or eating at district one, you have the option to go to this place for dessert! The Oreo Crunch bingsoo is amazing! Although it is $10 for a large, I do consider it worth it! There are marshmallows, Oreos, and brownie bites over the plain bingsoo! There's also a container of condensed milk with it! I absolutely love this place and would highly recommend coming here!

The shaved ice here is very large portioned, the design of the shaved ice is very artistically arranged. Very flavorful and refreshing on a hot Vegas day. Truly a place to get away from the heat and relax.

Pros: very good portion at a reasonable price. The place is clean and well maintained.

Con: can't really think of any at this given time.

5/5: will come again in the future most definitely

Loved this place. This cafe is definitely pleasing on the eyes. It's decor is all white with a foresty feel. 

I love that this coffee shop offers not only coffee and tea, but also snow ice! I mean it just blends in with their theme. Anyways! I've tried their snow ice before and it was massive! A family of 6 couldn't even finish it. Last time I got there I just got the original cold brew and man was it strong! The lady recommended me the chocolate cold brew, but I was trying to cut my dairy so I said nah it's okay next time. I also ordered one shot of espresso. And drinking that after a long day... I was wide awake. I was pretty surprised.

The only downside is the price. You won't find anything in the menu that is under $4. 

They also offer/ have stumptown coffee. As a NOT coffee connoisseur I don't really know how special that is. But if you love that, you gotta try them out. 

Their servers/ baristas are also very nice and helpful every time I come!

This place was the perfect place to come to on a hot 108 degree Las Vegas day!

Walking in, Snow White looked like a little cafe with the cutest interior decorations. I walked up to the counter to order a shaved ice bowl and there were about 8 different ones to choose from. (There were also coffee, tea and other drink options on the menu.) My boyfriend chose the mango one and I chose the green tea bowl. The Mango shaved ice was delicious but the Green Tea one was even better. Topped with mochi pieces, cheesecake pieces and green tea ice-cream sprinkled with pink chocolate shavings, I was in heaven. At first I thought that the $11 price on a bowl was expensive but after tasting this wonderful creation, It was definitely worth every penny.

One star less because of the unfriendly lady at the counter. Not once did she smile while ordering, and walking out we said thank you and good bye, she didn't even acknowledge us =T

This place is adorable! The coffee is delicious, and the atmosphere is delightful. I had the mint mojito and really enjoyed the fact that it was not too sweet. My best friend had the brown sugar tea (it tastes like boba without the chewiness) and we shared the caramel apple snow. That was delicious! Fresh apples, praline pecans, and caramel sauce over a delicious shave ice style snow. I will definitely come back!
Amazing! Came in just looking for dessert but got an entire experience instead. Atmosphere is nice, dessert is delicious! Customer service is on point! Love it
Our favorite shaved ice place in town!the ice just melt in your mouth!! Good place for summer time!

In an event if you are looking for something a little under the radar then look no further. Easy location and easy access from parking. I do love the green tea snow very light and easy flavors, got to love the topping that adds crunch to a soft dessert. Very clean design for the store lay out. I'd see myself coming over here and then.

Snow White is a 3-star cafe to me. I can list many pros about Snow White. However, I can list many cons too...

PROS: Snow White is a relatively spacious cafe that you can go to relax because they usually play some calming music. Though it is located in one of the most crowed malls in the area, Snow White stays pretty calm. Their shaved ice milk dessert is sooo good. I can finish the large bowl by myself. :D The interior is better than other cafes too. 

CONS: The other menu items are just too plain. Whenever I order their drinks, they taste like they were watered down. Also, they did not have enough employee to accommodate the customers. People had to wait in line for a long time to order and wait again to get what they have ordered. I think they should adjust their business hours too. I wish they extend their hours. 

Snow White is a great cafe to study and relax. It will be a much better place to visit if they can fix their drinks.

Best service. Best drinks. 100% recommend. I came here with some friends and we got boba. Definitely some of the best boba I've ever had and so cheap. Atmosphere is so chic and trendy. Great for pics. 10/10 would recommend.
The green tea tiramisu snow taste really good. Like what I eat in Japan :) the staff is very friendly! It was our first time there. We will come back every week! Small one is enough for me

Finally tried this place and was pleased with my first visit. The atmosphere is inviting and have this cozy and charming storylike feel. Tables were marble like top with wooden parisian bistro style chairs. If Snow White wanted to open an actual café, this place would fit that description. 

The main item that really stood out was the Bingsoo-Korean style shave ice. The cashier recommended the strawberry flavor bingsoo and was surprised that it was large enough to share with someone. The fresh strawberries and jam was just right with the condensed milk when mixed with the snow like shave ice. It was a good thing we only got one because we also got an Iced Lavender Vanilla Latte and Iced Matcha Green Latte. Both drinks were good and balanced. However I would really come back for their Bingsoo.

We came all the way from Seattle and I have to say, the drink here is spectacular! We got the taro milk tea with tapioca. The drink is perfectly sweetened and the tapioca is at a soft texture. We'll definitely revisit when we come back to Vegas!

Simple concept...amazing flavor. Not at all what I expected. Had the tiramisu snow. Was so light. Can totally see having this in the summer.  My son had the mango popping Boba vanilla milk tea.  Really good. Staff was really helpful in making suggestions. Came on a Sunday night. Not crowded but imagine it will be busy as the weather warms up.
Ordered the raspberry white mocha latte but when I got it was not worth the hype.. I does not look like the picture I saw on yelp and not satisfied with the customer service.

Very unique place, really nicely designed interior kinda modern vintage Snow White Castle lol it's never busy & crowded which I worry because I like the place and don't want it going out of business.

So for the food review. At first I was going in expecting shaved ice, like the ones I get in Hawaii. But this is way more sophisticated. It's a much finer shaved ice, it's more like eating fresh powder snow. They put it in a metal bowl to keep it cold, and it's flavored with whatever toppings you choose. So it's like a shaved ice sundae. It's so yummy and they give a good amount to share for two. If you like sweet desserts like I do, add the ice cream in there and the optional condensed milk. You won't be sorry lol

Oh and they also have an extensive coffee and tea menu too. So go check them out and experience a unique take on shaved ice.

I have already gone to this place twice because of how cute it is inside, but also of course because of their yummy desserts! I think this place is a great place to go with friends and family. They have a good amount of different options to choose from. The dessert we got had super soft shaved ice on the bottom topped with fruits and then the other one had brownies and wafers, so good! Don't really have no cons at the moment. Besides I already recommended it to a friend and they loved it! Will come back soon to try more of their menu, especially their drinks!

I came here since I was in the area and had some time to kill. Needed a place to study and heard this place was a good place to study. It was not. It's really loud even with only me and another person. Reason is that this is a dessert cafe. Families with kids come in and it can definitely get loud. I am okay with that but would prefer a quieter environment. Tables and chairs are smaller and not that many outlets. 

Drink was pretty good. I got their Mirror Mirror on the wall and they even readjusted the sweetness for me. I really liked my drink because it was the perfect balance of sweet and tart. My friend got the Thai Tea and it was not really good and tasted a bit watered down. 

I didn't get a chance to try their snow, but will definitely come back to try it.

-It's one of those shaved snow/ice/cold things place
-It's good!
-Aptly priced
-Cute decor
-Good lighting
-Friendly staff members
-It has like stumptown coffee or something, I see that advertised in chic/hipster places... so yay?

Come here if you want: to cool off with some cold stuff in your mouth, hang out with friends, cute place to end a date
Do not come here if: are not interested in shaved ice products, you need dim lighting, hate coming out to china town (boo you)

Loved this place for its theme and decor! Checked it out on a quiet Sunday and the servers were nice and informative. We ordered a nuttella iced latte, green tea and a shaved ice. All were great! The prices are a bit on the pricey side compared to the size that you get, but all is well other than that! =)
Tried the snow dessert for the first time. It was quite fun and yummy. Would definitely recommend getting the mango flavor!

I came here because of the name.

Honestly upon first glance I was a little dissapointed. Their menu was very bland and I almost left without ordering anything but i felt like that was rude so I ended up ordering an Iced Mojito Green Tea.

This was worth the trip in!

It's a very refreshing drink perfect for this Ridiculous Vegas heat! I will be back just for this drink!

There are a few good snow places in town, but Snow White stands out as the best for several reasons:
1. The theme. The inside of this place is cute and comfortable, a place you might actually want to spend time lounging. 
2. The specialty snows. Snow White has a great selection of specialties. You can probably get all these combinations at any other local place, but here they just have a better menu presentation. 
3. The teas. Not only is Snow White a Snow place, but they also have a great selection of milk teas/boba. 
4. The service. Obviously it varies at every place and every employee, but I've had the friendliest and fastest Snow service at Snow White. 

It's not super convenient to my house, but I'll go out of my way when craving snow.
It's cute and interesting, the snow has a great texture and mouth feel, the flavors are either too sweet or too mild, great tea selection

AMAZING! So finally we find the place that we love the most. So many flavours and the shaved ice is awesome, I don't feel it's too cold like ice or ice cream. There are more kinds of dessert here also. My family will definitely come back.
Always yummy! Love the atmosphere here. We try a new shaved ice each time we come. They are all unique and good
Best dessert ever! Especially in this heat it was perfect for this hot weather.  Love the variety desserts they offer.

I went for their shaved ice and I've heard about their coffees, but nobody told me about their teas. If the first impression wasn't a fluke, then their tea is also something to wax poetic about.

Snow White is a fairly new cafe and dessert shop at the corner of the busy plaza on Jones that contains stalwart restaurants such as District One, Chada Thai & WIne, (the original), and Asian BBQ & Noodles. That alone would guarantee them success if they were merely mediocre, but they're an excellent establishment.

The variant of shaved ice offered here is patbingsu (aka bingsoo, or spelling variants of those terms), a Korean style with toppings layered atop a bed of ice. It is distinct from the Taiwanese style (exemplified by Snowflake Shavery) where flavor is frozen into the milky ice, and the Hawaiian shave ice where syrups are applied. I ended up sharing a large ($9.95) mango "snow dessert" with my friend.

Not too long after our order (considering customers ahead in line), the ice arrived on a huge metal bowl with flared sides. I dug in to the much anticipated treat and found myself really enjoying it. The ice is shaved very finely, not like my favorite ribbony Taiwanese style or the coarser Hawaiian shave ice. The amount of mango with mango jelly on top of it was a lot more generous than I'd expected, and it was sweet but not overly so. The vanilla ice cream added a bit of creaminess to the bites more than anything, as did the condensed milk. I wasn't expecting much from something built atop unflavored ice, but it was surprisingly splendid.

With that out of the way, I've gotta talk about their tea. It was a tad late at night to try their coffee (which uses Stumptown beans and includes cold brew and nitro brew), but I was willing to take a smaller caffeine hit from one of their teas. Turns out that they do the same teas, flavored teas, and milk teas as everywhere else. Well, sorta. The jasmine tea ($3.75 for 24 oz) is the strongest jasmine tea that I've had in almost any of this sort of tea shop. It was sweetened to the perfect level as well. The sea salt cream (+$0.75) reminds me of another establishment not in town (perhaps Sharetea), and it's smooth and provides just the right saltiness that I've come to expect from that ingredient.

I decided to make one more visit a couple days afterward because I needed to see the quality of the boba ($0.50). The new shops have set a high bar for quality tapioca pearls. While this Snow White doesn't offer honey boba, their boba is close to the right texture, veering just a tad into "hard" territory. The drink that I tried this time, the toffee nut milk tea ($4.75 for 24 oz), was pretty good for a typical milk tea and not overly sweet. But moving forward, I'll probably stick to loose leaf teas like the jasmine for that powerful tea flavor.

The (men's) restroom was quite clean, so I have to credit their clean customers and their custodial care. And I really appreciate that they gave me a to-go cup when I couldn't handily down my drink after mistakenly not specifying to-go.

Based on what I've had so far, Snow White is really an awesome new business with a different take on shaved ice and some very competitive tea offerings. I'll be back soon to try their other bingsoo flavors and their coffee.
Our first time here. Very friendly helpful staff and awesome coffee. My daughter didn't like a recommended latte and they made her another that she did like and all was well. Will be back soon.

Great place for a refreshing dessert in Las Vegas; especially during the excruciating hot summer months. Visited this place with my wife and family and had a wonderful time. Great service and a lot of attention to detail. Nice interior decor sticking to the theme of their name - Snow White. Had multiple dishes since we wanted to try several dishes that were suggested by the employee that was working. They are almost like shaved ice gone wild for the better. 

Mango, Strawberry, and the Green Tea was very very good. Not too sweet and very refreshing. 

Also had their Cold Brew Coffee for a nice quicker picker upper without having to worry about the heat since it was during the summer. Served in a chilled/frozen mug - nice touch!

Must try while in Las Vegas.

In the event that my blurry iPhone 6+ camera has made the text on the picture I included illiterate, the red sign reads: 
"Review us on...yelp". "Show us your 5 star review and receive  a FREE 12oz Black/Green Tea with Sea Salt Cream"

"Snow White" is the most popular Korean shave ice spot on Yelp in the Las Vegas area.  The fact that they rely on a system of bribing to obtain their ratings instead of relying on the quality of their products is dishonest and unprofessional. 

As a result, the Soybean Shaved Ice was no where near the quality expected of "the best Shaved Ice/" in Vegas. 

The condensed milk was watered down and runny
The ice cream was Kirkland Signature Classic Vanilla (which is good, but not what I go out to eat for)
The Korean rice cake () was lumpy, uncharacteristically large and sparse. For the Large we ordered (for four people) we each got to eat one piece...

All in all, it was a cool and refreshing retreat from a 110 degree Vegas afternoon, which in turn may have made frozen treat taste better than it is. However, the blatant disregard for fair play amongst fellow Shaved Ice/ shops and the poor quality of ingredients and execution call for a harsh and thorough review: 2

Amazing place!

This is the dessert place to go to on a sweltering day!

Highly recommended!

Their watermelon and mango bingsoo is seasonal only! Its fruity, summer-y and refreshing! 

Blood orange lemonade was a bit too sweet for my taste. I will stick to my matcha lattes/frappes here instead until I figure out something new that I like. 

Bingsoos that i've tried so far: matcha, brownie, and watermelon/mango. The brownie one is good if you are a fan of chocolate indulgence. The matcha isnt overtly bitter however they add candy to it which makes it a little more sweeter than it should be. Watermelon/mango is seasonal only - its refreshing and fruity. The one thing that i liked in common with all the bingsoos is how their shaved ice had the appearance of actual snow, thus melts into your mouth like actually tasting a snowflake that falls onto your tongue lol! Although I honestly would come here more towards the spring as the vegas heat strangely melts the ice a lot faster... Either that or time went by way to fast while conversing with friends for me to notice haha.

The first few weeks this place opened though, it was nice being greeted by one of their overzealous employees. I forgot his name but he was very convivial and would wander to our table full of friends to engage in random conversation when the opportunity strikes haha! I liked that his unique sense of customer service wasn't robotic at all but moreso ethusiastic. Having a flamboyant personality definitely did help with the overall guest experience as well.

The shop's interior was lovely, but that's only because I'm biased with anything white marble. They had small accents and trinkets that emphasized on the Disney character Snow White which had a unique and surreal touch of ambiance. I do like the idea of this place and can imagine myself coming through randomly for a sweet craving with random conversation; I only wish that they extended their hours more (hint hint 2am please) as it would be a decent alternative to Icy Juicy since its in the same plaza.

I love their drinks and their decors and also their shaved snow. I like how they have a variety of teas, and their salted cream is actually really good compared to the other places. There are plenty of tables, and their snow is fluffy and different to other places. I like their green tea the most since it has that bitterness that other places try to avoid- I personally love that taste.

The only complaint I have towards Snow White is their staff. They are definitely not the friendliest or welcoming workers. They never smile at you nor greet you when you come in. They would walk around the cafe and tell us that our drink is ready after awhile it has been out. I dont really understand why they would bring out the snow but not the drinks. That I do find odd. Else than that, I like coming here if I am nearby.

A nice cafe with shave ice and coffee drinks.  It is located in a shopping center with some amazing restaurants of various types (all Asian, but many varieties), so Snow White is particularly good before or after a meal.
Avocado shakes are awesome and the squid balls. Nice place and the staff are super friendly and honest.

Yum yum yum. If you're wanting shaved ice with whatever toppings, come here! Bought a custom ice shave large for $10something! It was delicious and fed my family of 4 kids, myself, and the hubby. Nice feel in the shop and perfect for a hot afternoon!

This coffee shop is the perfect place to share a nice hot cup of joe with some friends or have a shot of espresso as you pour over your books to study for an exam. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful to make sure I got the exact latte that I wanted. Also, their ice desserts are to dieeeee for! A must have for anytime you stop in this quaint little cafe.
I love their nitro coffee and snowflake dessert. I also tried their lavender latte. very good. I just wish they were open in the morning. I like my coffee when I get up. LOL.
Love, love, love this place! I'm a huge fan of Bad Owl in Henderson, and I can honestly say this place stole my 1st place spot for coffee, boba, and ice cream!

It was my first time visiting the place, and the decorations was really nice and modern.  It had decorations that fit the theme of Snow White.  My friend and I ordered two of their lemonade.  It was good, but I thought it would have more of a wow factor to it.  It mostly tastes like Kolaid, but a lemonade version.  It was still good, but if you want a new fresh taste maybe choose a different flavor besides the Dessert Pear and Blue Wave.

Their Matcha Latte was really nice and warm with a rich taste of the green tea.  It had a cute art~

So, at Snow White it seems their Bingsoo (Shaved Ice) is their big dessert dish.  My friends and I ordered the Caramel Apple Bingsoo which was delicious!  It had Apple pieces, Caramelized Apple like when you eat Apple pie, pecans, and ice cream.  The large was a good size to feed 3 people.

Wow. Just Wow. This is vey similar to Philippino halo halo ...but this is a hundred times better! 

I got the green tea snow and chose the green tea ice cream to top it. It was just refreshing and good without being too sweet. By the way I don't know what deal they made with the devil to get the ice to be so fine...and NOT MELT, but it was ridiculous! 

This was definitely worth the trip away from the Strip and made my Vegas trip more memorable.

The only thing I liked from this place was their bingsu bowl. Their cakes were undercooked and so was their pizookie. It took more than 15 minutes to get our molten lava cake, and when it came it...it came out like chocolate pudding which was quite disappointing. The drinks tasted watered down, and the service was kind of slow. 

Cool concept, but if you're thinking desert just stick to the bingsu.
Omg the mango and strawberry and mango snow cake is amazing! And great service too! Currently trying the Snow White mirror mirror on the wall. So tasty!

This is not shaved ice but the concept is similar. It's snow (ice that's shaved into a finer, cloudier texture), and I like it much better because it's softer and fluffier so you don't feel too guilty after finishing your bowl. I ordered their strawberry and mango snow and the cuts of fruit they use are incredibly fresh. There are layers of fruit and fruit jams between the snow and the portions (small or large) are reasonable for the price point. Small size is for 1 (maybe 2 not very hungry people) to share, the large will easily feed 3 people. Get the large.

Knocking off one star for the price. It's about $11 for the large and $6 for the small. Los Angeles snow places have those prices at $8 and $5 respectively.

It's a cute spot to get drinks and desserts. Decorations inside are nice. One thing I would have to say is that they should work on their menu. It's up in the front but there is only one copy of it and when there are other customers there, they have to share or pass the menu around. It was a bit confusing to me. My friend Kim and I ordered the mango and strawberry shave ice. It was good. It comes in two different size. We got the small cup. It was still big enough to share for two even though t was a small. I would come back to try other things on the menu.

I think this place looks better than it tastes. There's a lot to look at as it's beautifully decorated with snow and Snow White themed decor. Definitely a cute date spot.
