I tried the Oreo bingsoo, which was just OK. It wasn't amazing, and maybe even a bit bland. The chilled bowl that it came in was cool. I can't judge the other fruit bingsoos as I haven't tried it, but was not sure I wanted to spend upwards of $12 on bingsoo with so little a variety of toppings and fruit choices. It is a little pricey here, so I feel as though you're paying for the environment more so than the desserts. It's worth a try, but I can't say I'm a fan.

This place is great! The decor is super cute, perfect place to bring friends or just hang solo. So many dessert options to choose from! My first time there, I tried their Tirimisu Snowflake "cake" I had no idea what to expect but let me tell you... it was delicious!! Super light, but still had the richness of a real Tirimisu dessert! The snow ice was so soft and light. If you're a fan of Tirimisu you will LOVE this. 
2nd visit we tried the Mango Snowflake. It was so "creamy" and had a mild & mellow (non-acidic) taste and the  mango was fresh! Organic too! 
I will be definitely be coming back to try their other desserts and drinks! 
*NOTE they serve Stumptown Coffee & boba!!

What happens when you're hangry, grumpy, tired..and have a 9 hour post-Vegas road trip coming up? You CAFFEINATE. Lots and lots and lots of caffeine. 

The BF loves coffee and hates sugar. I love sugar and hate coffee. He yelped cold brew coffee, and I told him I'd order whatever I could find there bc I was not about to make multiple stops. So pleasantly surprised to find Snow White offers both coffee AND boba. While neither the cold brew nor the boba was 5-star worthy, both were decently good and exceeded expectations. 

Add in cute decor, good music, great service, and SUPER CLEAN bathrooms, and I'm one happy, caffeinated road trip buddy/gf. If only every compromise in a relationship was this easy hahahaha.

To start off my review, I was in awe about the name of the cute cafe. It's quite creative if you ask me, anyways, walking in, I legitimately fell in love with the back drop of this location. Great way to advertise while trying out the spot. 

I forgot what type of shaved ice I ordered but I do have photos below, whoops! I'm barely writing the reviews after EDC, bare with me guys!! The first bite practically melted inside my mouth bursting with the right amount of sweetness galore. I was quite surprised that it wasn't overly sweet and simple. I don't know what it is or how they were able to perfect that but they did. Haven't had perfect shaved ice like this in a while considering I do try almost every shaved ice creameries. GOOD JOB GUYS!! 

The ambiance was cute as well. A little tight inside but it is in a cute plaza. I would probably recommend this to my friends and family if they are ever in Vegas. Highly satisfied with the great customer service and layout of their shaved ice!!! BEST I'VE EVER HAD!!!

Yummy food and great service. The staff are very welcoming and friendly. Great atmosphere for gathering with friends. Not to mention the variety of shaved ice offers. I only try the green tea one but it was delicious and satisfying!

Friendly staff, adorable decor, and your average coffee menu. They brew Stumptown coffee? I've never had it before but my drink was pretty mediocre. 

I tried the Lavender Latte which was recommended from the cashier after discussing my preferences. Honestly, I have had better but I'll give this place another shot and just try a simple cup of coffee. 

The BROWNIE BINGSOO. YAAASSSSS. It suited my taste but not my wallet(I mean my bf's wallet, TY BABE), which is why I gave them 4 stars. haha I'm poor. The neat thing with the bingsoo is that it's served in an ICY bowl to keep it cold. That was pretty cool... Get it??? ;) Overall, I'll go back :)
The lady that helped me was very nice and funny. I didn't know what to eat but she told me some items. I picked the mango shaved ice desert and it's really good.

I've had this little sweet shop bookmarked for some time now and finally got to give it a try with some friends. It's located in a strip mall on Jones with a ton of other great foodie spots. 

They offer different snow cream desserts, coffees, teas and more. We opted to share the green tea and Oreos snow cream desserts. The large and small in those two were the perfect amount for the four of us. I loved the textures of the snow mixed with the ice cream and getting condensed milk to pour over the top is a must. The flavors were all delicious and complimented each other perfectly.

This place is seriously bomb. I'll be back again soon enough for more sweets action and I wanna give the coffee a try to. It smelled great!

This place is so delicious. It's very chill and clean. I got a Nutella latte and it was delicious and not too sweet, which is what I love! The cashier was really nice and complimented my sister on her Doctor Who wallet. I love it here. Good service and good coffee.

Last time I came, I got the mango snow ice and tiramisu snow ice, which was  perfect for the hot Vegas weather! It was refreshing and good for it's price. Also, if you write a 5 start review, you get a free 12 oz black/green tea with sea salt cream! 

Today, I got the soybean snow ice, which is a classic korean bingsoo  it consists of fluffy shaved ice, red bean, traditional soybean rice cake, and corn flakes. This definitely hit the spot in my belly!
Tiramisu snow is so awesome! But sea salt green tea was disappointing. I still give five stars cuz the shaved ice was too good!
I love Snow White! I've been wanting to come here for very long but I finally got the chance to try it. I ordered the mango shaved ice and I really liked it! Super nice for a hot day Vegas.

Friendly service! The barista explained how the stumptown nitrogen cold brew was comparable to the texture of guiness. Lol! And she was right. It had a very smooth texture but the taste was comparable to some herbal medicine...  I would much rather stick to my regular cold brew or americano. It was worth the try though! Also tried to chocolate brownie bingsoo and it honestly just tasted like a shaved ice version of haagen dazs chocolate ice cream. Nothing too special about it. I think the fruit ones would be more refreshing so I will definitely be back next time to try the mango or strawberry ones!

Wow this place is really good me and my significant other got the sweet mango bingsoo w/ added strawberry and it was awesome! Ill be going here again and telling my colleagues about this place, glad she took me here..

BS +

Did I just  seriously pay $8.65 for one small cup of shaved ice with nothing except chopped strawberries which I had to pay $1.00 extra for.  Even when I didn't have other stuff in it.  Plus they put it in a dinky Styrofoam cup.  Meanwhile I see everyone with the nice clay bowls.  Damn I must be a degenerate to deserve  this.  I am NOT giving this a one star because it would be unfair and the shaved ice is pretty good.  The place was clean.  But the price is crazy.  So we came in here after eating at the Asian BBQ next door because they do not have anything sweet.  I immediately Yelp to search for a spot and magically this Snow White hipster café appeared.  YES! So the lady in the counter (the receipt served by Man) was not really excited to see us.  I explained to her that my father-in-law was diabetic and I asked what do they have that's not too sweet or what can they offer.  She looks at me and says "coffee".  HA! I said to myself if I wanted coffee I would go to Starbucks.  I stayed calm and we tried to figure it out.  So at the end of it all I asked for the strawberry shaved ice.  She told me my total and I wasn't paying attention at first until I checked my receipt.  I didn't want to be rude thinking maybe the shaved dessert would be bomb and they would hook it up.  Uhm... No.  It's literally 4 strawberries chopped up and shaved ice.  I shouldn't have even tipped if this was the case.  This is nuts.  I recommend this to people who want to try it.  It's nice and warm inside.  It has a cool rustic feel and it's cute.  But I didn't have a good experience.  Upon leaving I even smiled and the counter lady didn't bother saying goodbye or thank you.  I am not coming back here.  I am not paying $7 for shaved ice.  The shaved ice was still good.  The place is still nice.  This was just from a bad experience.  Next time I'll just stick to boba and  call it a day.  If I want shaved ice I'll just get it from my refrigerator and throw in some strawberries and ice cream.  

Location is CLEAN, NICE, NEW
Staff Not friendly, not really informative.
Parking lot is SHARED and SMALL
Restrooms Did not use
Seating is Nice and Clean
Pricing is A BIT EXPENSIVE

Came here at around 12pm on a Weds and there was only one worker, she was really friendly and worked efficiently despite having 2 tables ahead of us so we didn't wait too long. I like how this place offers the option of a smaller shaved ice bowl since I usually have trouble finishing the large ones. Although less aesthetically pleasing, the small shaved ice goes in a white paper cup but she still makes it very pretty. We got mango strawberry shaved ice and a tiramisu shaved ice, both were really good and the tiramisu was so pretty. The mango and strawberry I feel could've had more in it for bingsoo like beans or mochi, the topping were overwhelming after a certain point. We also got a caramel macchiato and that was just alright. Overall, great dessert place to stop in for some shaved ice!

This is a unique shaved snow dessert place. I like this whimsical window frames on the ceiling and there are little details in the store to make this place fairy tale like. I had the tiramisu shaved ice and the Oreo shaved ice. The tiramisu was better than the Oreo because it had cream in the cup and a side of espresso to pour over the ice. I felt that the added liquids made the ice more creamy.  The Oreo was ok. It was chewing on cold  marshmallows and cookie bits, but at least it matches the flavor description. 

It is worth noting that the shaved snow has a  fine fluffy texture so there is a lot of air in between the parts. So, no, it's not like shaved ice where the particles are densely packed together. It is much fluffier and less filling. I would recommend trying this place out as it is a unique dessert experience if you have not had snow dessert before. Go for the creamy or added fruit options as it will add more flavor to the snow.

The GOOD:
The only way to describe the texture is like fresh powder just dropped on the slopes...it's not like a snowcone, or like fluff ice or even ice cream..it's much much lighter...literally like snow...hence the name!

Basically, it's cream snow shaved into a cup and you pick ur toppings or choose from their  menu of pre-selected flavors.

The BAD:
Not knowing or being in the place before was looking for pictures or something to get the taste buds going...but no luck...the menus and selections are easy to read...but hard to grasp the concept if you've never had it before...you gotta just pick one of their flavors and dive into it.  

P.s.  the girl behind was friendly and service was quick...she brings your order out to you (real spoons)...no plastic spoons here..yay!
Very delicious shaved ice cream! The large is huge, perfect for two people. I definitely plan to return to try the green tea shaved ice cream.

I've been here a couple times, and the reason I waited to do this review I wanted to make sure that I got to try other things on the menu. So I am going to do this review based off the snow and the coffee separately.

The snow: I've had snow many different ways and normally the snow (or finely shaved ice) is also flavored. What's unique about this place is that the snow is not flavored. They just pack it with a lot of different things. I'm not sure if anyone is familiar with what halo-halo is but it's the same except the ice is shaved very finely! It was amazing though! I really love the mango one because it isn't too sweet! I think that with the other flavored added on it might have been too sweet. I really enjoy the snow here! I love the fruit ones and next time o lab on having the Oreo one! 

The coffee and tea: I was excited and I think the coffee is made well! However when I ask questions about the drink I would like them to be knowledgable of the type of tea...or even the fact that they have sea salt cream. I feel like I knew more about tea and their menu then they did! 

The place: it is super cute and I love it! There theme is Snow White so the place is woods-y and has unique art pieces that relate to Snow White some of them are more dark and baroque and some of them are really cute! There flavor theme is caramel apple and I really enjoy that! The shop is very cutesy but not overly cutesy! It's not on a hello kitty level but it has its own unique cute-ness! 

Overall really enjoy this shop. Just wish that the flavored were not as artificial for the floral flavors and that the baristas were well versed in there products.

Bingsu or bingsoo is shaved ice with a variety of toppings. I've been wanting to try this place but hesitant due to the price.  Today, we finally did and it was not bad, but I don't think I will be a regular. The place was packed with young adults who brought their back packs to sit and study. I guess they let you do that since you pay $11 for an order of their shaved ice.

Decor was nice but parking is hard to find specially at night time.

Love the Oreo bingsoo! Definitely coming back to this place. I want to try the other flavors! 
Service was really good. The lady was so nice and helpful! 
Ambiance was perfect too! Really cute especially the floor.
I absolutely love their tiramisu snow! Very fluffy and delicious. I've been coming here regularly for about a year now and it's great. Good atmosphere, fast service, great dessert! :D

Bingsoo is on point! Love the decor 
But I had to take off a star...
I just think it's really ridiculous to charge extra for the condense milk when they charge $11 for shaved ice already. They only gave us one third of a shot... 
Don't charge for the condense milk,we will be back

Snow White cafe has good boba as well as iced tea. Prices are reasonable! I recommend the Thai tea, and the rest of the menu looks really unique too! Atmosphere is really nice and clean. Good to get the perfect ig pic in!

This isn't Hawaiian shave ice. It's shave ice's fancier cousin from out of town.

Bingsoo (or patbingsoo) is a Korean style of shave ice with various fruit and vegetables sweet toppings. These were unexpected since we were looking for just a little something to top off the night. These were far from "little" and we're actually pretty formidable, if we're going to be honest. 

If you have ever made snow ice cream, you're familiar with this process and the wonderful "soup" at the end. Set aside some time for this. 

Cute place, too! I look forward to seeing how it grows on the next few months.

Got the lavender latte here one day.  Coffee prices way too high.  $5.50 before tax for a small latte?  It was good but not THAT good! Super slow service also.  I would come back if the price wasn't ridiculous and the service was more efficient.

I should expand my horizons... but I'm just stuck on their iced Nutella lattes! It's so rich and tasty! The cafe is really cute and very clean. It's a great spot to meet up with friends as they have tons of tables and chairs. Also, the staff is so friendly and sweet. They really take pride in what they do and make sure your drink is made to your liking. I really wished I lived closer to Snow White Cafe, because I'd take a Nutella latte over my go-to toffee nut latte from Starbucks any day!

They serve Stumptown coffee and have Stumptown cold brew, affogato, blended drinks and teas too. I haven't had a chance to try the bingsoo yet... the portions look pretty big!
Awesome dessert and even better service. Tiramisu is a mist! If you're in vegas, this a great spot to fulfill your sweet tooth. Deidra was great, friendly and provided great service!

It tastes like a lighter alternative to ice cream.  Just had the tiramisu cake and it was delicious! A shot of cold brew coffee/maybe espresso is provided on the side to add to taste.  Prior visit I had mango snow cake and that was yummy as well.   Clean women's bathroom.  Good cool air during this inferno hot summer. Friendly customer service.   Quick to get the tasty treats out to the table.
some of the best snow i've had in a while, i really love their milk tea and mango snow its the best in town. highly recommend this place

Such a cute and sweet cafe!  The variety of flavors is what really attracted me, with a plethora of options for milk tea additives and snow cream sweets . It's really the perfect place to take a friend from out-of-town, your significant other, or even your baby cousin after a soccer game. 

The music and overall ambience makes it the perfect venue for your studying needs! I can definitely see myself coming here so much more often for some tasty desserts on a HOT Vegas day!  Be sure to stay hydrated, by the way! Haha

An ideal cafe and dessert stop. We dropped by after finishing up next door at D1. We had the sweet mango bingsoo which was so smooth. I ordered the Iced Mocha which is my favorite all-day drink. Will definitely be back to sample the other bingsoo flavors and the matcha tea.. mmm
Excellent service.  The desert is the best on Spring  Mountain.  We have been coming here since it opened

Being in Vegas, you already know snow's the way to go to beat this heat. No, I was not brided into this review for a free drink , but  Snow White is truly a great place. The price is reasonable, as you can get either a small or large depending on the amount of people you come with. The workers are really considerate and the aestethic of the store is exceptional. This would be the perfect place to "chill out" with either friends or a date, especially at night.
Live close by. Very decent. Very good place to get myself organized. Music is terrible though lol but I do like the place

OMG! Tiramisu!

Located in the Jones shopping center at DI, center has a lot of parking. 

Snow White has an urban style look to it. A nice setup of hanging Edison style lights decorate the ceiling. 2 awesome liking chandeliers accent either side of the cafe. Impressed my wife and she's an interior designer. Very clean and kept. 

What was ordered:
Tiramisu Snow

All I can say is, WOW! I am not an expresso type person, but the combination with cream cheese and French valrhona was quite a treat. They use Stumptown roasters here, and brew it to excellence. 

Thanks to the owners, we now appreciate Korean snow so much more. They take pride in their work here. Great job. The only possible negative I can say here is, location location location. Put this bad boy in the Centennial hills area, and they will definitely beat a lot of the competition. My name is Michael Mixon and I approve this message. Definitely a return customer here.

This place is awesome. A cute set up and themed cafe store, the coffee is great and they have a variety of flavors. I get either the rose or lavender latte and it's pretty legit, especially iced.
The staff here is super sweet and I love chatting with them whenever I go here, definitely a spot to make your regular stop.

How cute is this place? Feminine, woodsy, and whimsical with a "Snow White" theme. Not so much on the classic Disney princess, but more so the ornate mirrors. They specialize in bingsoo, a Korean shaved ice desserts that comes in various flavors like chocolate, oreo, or fruit. I decided to go with the special, tiramisu snow, and it was yummy! All the elements of a classic tiramisu were there. I wish there was more ladyfingers though! It only came with one. 

They are actually a serious coffee and tea place. Most Asian places just offer milk teas and boba drinks, but this place serves up the well known, Stumptown coffee.  I had the mint mojito cold brew and it was exactly how I imagined it would taste. I would like to try their lattes some day as well, I think I hear the lavender latte calling my name. 

The barista is super sweet and very helpful! Great customer service!

It's all so magical!!!

Snow White Cafe enchants us with Bingsoo a Korean shaved ice dessert with sweet goodies such as chopped fruit, condensed milk, fruit syrup, and Azuki beans.

I ordered the Chocolate Bingsoo which is a mixture of brownie chunks, cocoa powder and decorated with artisan rolled wafers. I like that the ice itself wasn't flavored to avoid over sweetness, it was just covered with the toppings. 
It felt like I was eating snow, and with the chocolate smothered all over, it's the most satisfying icy dessert I have ever had anywhere in Vegas.  

The place feels fairy tale esque, adorned with beautiful paintings of Snow White along with a magic mirror on the wall. 

Snow White Cafe is definitely worth a visit so I highly recommend checking it out.
This place is super yummy! I got a tea and snow strawberry yummy ice cream. I'll be back for sure. We need one on the north side of town.
Super happy to find a Korean style shaved ice place, but a little disappointed in the topping to shaved ice ratio (need more toppings, less ice!). Love it nonetheless, because bingsoo.

Ever since coming back from Seoul, S. Korea, my goal was to find a good bingsu place here in Las Vegas. 

Went here on a Sunday evening, 45 minutes before closing time and to my surprise, there were a lot of people inside. It was bad enough that there was only one person behind the counter and they have a lot of people coming in.

I couldn't give this a perfect score because they need to put more flavor into their shaved ice and not just milk shaved ice and about 5 spoonful of toppings. And their sea salt green tea was really bitter, you might want to ask for a little bit of sugar if needed.

We wanted coffee and possibly a snack before our long trip back and this place looked good on Yelp so we decided to give them a try. The decor is Snow White themed and very cute. The mint mojito coffee was not the best tasting but was super strong, effectively keeping us awake the whole trip back and then some. I would recommend that they work on making that drink taste better.. I also tried the Sunrise tea and thought it was really yummy. We really wanted a Green tea shaved ice but they were out of the ingredients to make it so that was disappointing. Overall would recommend.

passed by this place quite by accident on the way somewhere else and decided to loop back and give it a try.    It was a pleasant surprise.    Light and airy "pulverized ice powder" they call snow can be topped with a wide variety of toppings including our choices of mango sauce, brownie bites, marshmallow and fruity pebbles.    Very refreshing on a 105 degree day !
Amazing bingsu and great location.

I've got a shocking confession.

Before coming to Snow White, I had never had anything Nutella-related. Not spread, not bread -- no cookie nor pastry. Luckily, I've got awesome Yelp friends, and Stefany V. took the time to make the UYE that introduced me to the world that is Nutella .... kinda.

I'm not a huge fan of coffee, to be honest. I normally order fraps when accompanying others to coffee houses. Today was a different day, however -- one of the first days of true Las Vegas Summers hit the day of the event, and I was already medium-rare by the time I arrived. I wanted something cold, and wanted to try something new. I ordered the Nutella Latte, and Rachel D. got the Vanilla Latte for contrast. That's exactly what we got after trying them both.

The Nutella Latte was pretty rich in coffee taste, and though you can definitely tell there's a good amount of chocolate goodness inside, it's pretty rich -- and ultimately tastes like a dark chocolate ice coffee. Pretty good, but a bit *too* rich for my taste. Still enjoyed it though, despite the Nutella being on the muted side of the flavor scale.

The Vanilla Latte was a much different story. With a creamy, sweet base that has a strong vanilla aftertaste. This was really nice, and lead me to switch with Rachel.

Service is really easy to sum up: Though at times the wait seemed to be a bit long, we realized that there was only one person working both the register and making the drinks. She was really nice, and did the very best she could and then some. I had no problem with a few extra minutes.

While the Nutella was like a dark, rich red wine, the Vanilla was like a sweet dessert white; offering a delish contrast. I highly recommend ordering both, and sharing with a pal.

Has a great atmosphere and sheik decoration. I love their.










Good restrooms too.

Its our first time trying out korean shaved ice. So far, it was not a let down at all.  It was very refreshing especially coming out in a 113degree weather.  I tried the tiramisu and its something to come back to. Kids had oreo and mango based shaved ice and they loved it. Ordered them to go since they usually dont get to finish their deserts but this time was different, cleaned out bowls.

Came here with a friend who's an Elite Yelpper.  Drove by this place a couple times and didnt think much of it but coming inside, I was pleasently surprised.  

Artwork on the walls is beautiful, reminds me of Mark Ryden's work.

Unique menu, at least for me, I dont frequent these types of places.  

I had the Affogato, espresso shot with choice of ice cream scoop.  I liked the bitter hot espresso with the cold sweet ice cream.  They also charged me for an iced latte, which I didnt want, but I didnt pay attention.  It was good, nothing special.

If a friend wanted to come and check it out, I would go with but I wouldnt come to satisfy a craving.

But yes, check it out at least once

In April, I was in Seoul, Korea with my boyfriend and we discovered something phenomenal there. We discovered modern Korean shaved ice where they use milk. It was shaved milk topped with fruits and condensed milk. So it's always surprising when we find a place that holds a similar concept to that. 

I felt as though Snow White took forever to open. FOREVER. Now that I think about it, it seems like that's how it is with a lot of the establishments in Las Vegas. They take forever to open due to problems with their construction contract. Blah! 

Anyways, we talked with one of the girls in there and we found out that they pretty much are doing the same thing as Korean shaved ice where they use milk. Or at least that's what they said. The consistency is a bit rougher than what we're used to and if there is supposed to be milk in there, it's not a whole lot of it. 

We ended up ordering a strawberry bingsoo. It had shaved ice topped with strawberries with strawberry jam in between. Then they had condensed milk for you to pour onto your shaved ice. It was pretty good. It's great to be able to have some Korean shaved ice in this city that's not the usual patbingsoo. They have plenty of options -- they even have the tradition where they use the peanut powder. Most of their shaved ices are also topped with ice cream..

The only downside of it is the price. It costs about $10 average per bingsoo. But it's such a large portion that you can share it between 3-4 people so, in the end, the cost isn't that much. It may seem much if you're just coming here with a party of 2 though. 

Overall, it's pretty good. Very refreshing, especially during the summer. The bowls they use are ice cold when it's brought out to you, which is really nice! I would definitely come back and suggest people give it a try.

Wow! This unassuming little Disney themed coffee/dessert place was beautiful inside. It's isn't overwhelmingly Snow White themed, but this is the way I would want my house to be decorated. They serve stumptown coffee, so you know you are getting quality coffee. I didn't try their desserts but they are open till midnight on Saturday, so I'll have to stop in again soon.

The Snow Desserts are the perfect snacks to cool yourself down in Vegas! They have a variety of flavors ranging from sweet mango to oreo. I got the Roasted Soybean Snow which I got addicted to on a trip to Korea! The snow ice was super fluffy and the flavor was on point. It all blended together perfectly with the green tea ice cream, red bean and mochi! I only wish it wasn't as pricy as it was ): It's about $6 for a small cup and $10 for a large that you can share. Personally, my friend and I killed the large between the both of us because it was so good lol. 

Snow White Cafe sits in a popular plaza so be prepared to hunt for parking. The interior design is super cute but I wish they would turn up the A/C more! I would definitely come back to get their desserts and try their drinks!

Been here couple of times.  We like it.  It was always nice. Try it.  It's lovely place.  Everything was cute.  Now every time we have dinner in the area.  We have to stop here for dessert.  We have tried a few different snow flavors.  Green tea or mango or strawberry all of them are good the nitro coffee is a must have!

Great place! 
Very clean and welcoming ! 
Second time here and it's a amazing environment !(:
Not kidding about the Snow White theme(: very cute

First time I came here was around lunch time on a weekday. It wasn't busy at all, and we only ordered a latte and bought a can of stumptown cold brew. The service was a bit slow then, even though we only ordered drinks. Been meaning to come back for a while and try their snow dessert. Came back on a weekend night, we ordered a large green tea snow to share between the two of us. The portion was a good amount, but honestly, I think $9.95 for dessert is a bit overpriced. On the other hand, I thought the green tea snow was awesome. I was afraid that all of their desserts would be too sweet for me, but this one wasn't sweet at all. The matcha powder and green tea ice cream go so well with the red beans, almonds and rice cakes. The condensed milk comes on the side so you can pour as much of it as you prefer. Definitely one of the best desserts I've had in town. I like the Snow White themed interior, and their service was good this time as well, didn't wait too long for the order to come out. I would definitely come back for more snow desserts and try new flavors!

Tried new toppings. Favorites are the green tea mochi and aloe jelly. Didn't have high expectations at the beginning, but both the mochi and jelly had so much flavor. Tasted very fresh and went very well with my green tea snow with strawberry jam. Will come back for more!
This is the first time we come to snow white cafe, the ambiance and the place was good. They mango and tiramisu snow cakes are the best. We love it very much
I'm surprised not many of these are opened. Light and fluffy melt in your mouth ice cream. I like how it isn't heavy like actual ice cream. It taste healthier and I just can't stop eating them.

Your snow is literally made with blood sweat and tears here . Not sure why but every time I come here you have one person on staff doing everything by themselves . Taking orders, making money transactions, phone calls , making drinks , snow , cleaning dishes , everything . The poor guy can't even catch his breath . It wasn't busy at all but I can tell this guy is exhausted and overworked . I give him props . The ice and food is so amazing but i just can't stand a place who is so cheep to hire more than one staff and obviously treats their employees like crap .

I've only come here twice, and both times I ordered the almond milk tea with boba. I'm actually surprised, the drink is quite good for not being a dedicated boba shop! 

My sister ordered the white peach green tea lemonade. It was refreshing, and she liked it!

The interior is super cute as well. Great ambience and beautiful decor. If I was still a student, I'd totally come here to study. Plenty of plugs everywhere to charge phones or laptops (for customers only which is understandable).

Snow Cakes AKA bingsoo here are scrumptious.
The shaved snow's consistency is really like snow, a unique texture that I haven't experienced at other shaved ice places. There are many combinations to choose from, but you can alsi create your own. Stumptown cold brew coffee is available here as well as black tea, green tea, a blue tea, slushes, espresso, sea salt cream, and a salty cream cheese topping that I haven't tried. Actually, I've really only had the snow cakes but I'll be back to try a drink.

You can never find a decent snow dessert here in Vegas until Snow White showed up about two months ago. Love the theme of this place perfect location, and beautiful layout inside. Me and girlfriend want to try this place for a very long time. We both shared the matcha shave ice with vanilla ice cream, mango slices, and condensed milk. 

I was very impress with the flavoring. Becuase usually in some other places the ice over takes the flavor. But this time was very good of a balance of flavor, and the mango help it a lot as well. I give props to dessert places that give complimentary water. So other place take notes ! The service was great they give good recommendation on what to put. Come to this place !

This is  my second time !!!!
   Here very good place to meeting with your friends !!!!

I'm not sure what is going on. There is a hand written note on a boarded up door that says closed.  There is not a date of reopening posted. I was looking forward to a great coffee. Hopefully everything works out & they will open sooner than later.
Another lil gem in the middle of Chinatown . One word Fabulous !!!! A must try ! Do yourself and your palette a favor and try the snows ... Divine

This place was good - nicely decorated and had a sweet vibe. I got a tea which was good and Tiramsu snow dessert which was tasty and they gave plenty. Service was timely and informative. Nice little gem. Would go back! :)
The best tea in the city.  You have to try the Sunset Tea. The tiramisu is something different,  but it is fine. The tiramisu is made of shaved ice.

Tasty, nifty, sugary, cheery, frosty, icy, juicy....no I ain't talkin' 'bout the seven dwarves....I'm talkin' 'bout the bingsoo! 

Visited on Saturday 6-25-16 at 6pm to see what all the fuss is about. $10.95 plus tax got me a strawberry bingsoo, which is a Korean shaved ice.   It's unlike any dessert I've ever had! The shaved ice is super cooled and so thin it's like a powder...like snow! 

The snow was topped with fresh strawberries, a scoop of strawberry ice cream, and came with a side of sweetened condensed milk to pour over it.  My only complaint is that they scoop their ice cream ahead of time and then freeze it which gave it a bizarre texture on the outside.  Does it really save you folks that much time ?  Come on now.  -_- 

I can't wait to go back and try the chocolate and mango varieties.  It looks like they have some tasty beverages as well that I'd like to try.

Come here for the bingsoo... not the tea. 

The patbingsoo's here are hugeee! Just one order is enough to satisfy a group of 4 people. Got the Sweet Mango bingsoo and it was delicious. The ice was so finely shaved that it had the texture of snow ice instead of shaved ice that most Korean bingsoo have. The amount of mango was pretty generous as well... only complain is that we wished that there was more condensed milk given to us. (Which we got more of... for an extra $1.50) 

I also decided to try their flavored ice tea... which I would not recommend. It tastes like lipton iced tea mixed with whatever flavor syrup you asked for....just meh lol
Friendly service and yummy drinks! Stumptown cold brew! I need to try the coconut one next time. D

More of a dessert place than a coffee shop, I'd say, as the desserts and the boba are the highlighted items. As far as shaved ice goes, I think they do a nice job with it--it's not my favorite dessert, but I've had it a few times, and they do a solid job with it. The service was also patient and helpful, which is a plus. The inside of the place is nice, and there are a few outlets around (not too many though).
Best bingsoo I've had so far in Las Vegas. It's a great modern kozy little place. Great place to meet up with some friends and share a dessert.
Best dessert I have had in 20 years. Unbelievable shaved ice with so many different flavors including chocolate brownie you would love it

The employees are cool, but they don't listen when I asked to make my iced latte a certain way. I asked for drizzled caramel and they gave me a transparent caramel syrup. I like the place and its style and atmosphere but the employee in the day time are not with the program. My second time here.

"When the raindrops come tumbling, remember you're the one who can fill the world with sunshine." ? Snow White

Ultimate Queen, Meghan L., had told me about Snow White a while back and it had stay in my bookmarks for a good while. With time to kill on a sunny Friday afternoon, we had decided to stop by! 

Arguably known for their dessert (bingsoo), we had came for some drinks instead. Hey, we had a big lunch so no one wanted dessert. I had a wild strawberry loose tea that was served in a french press. I felt fancy with my little tea cup. The first cup went down nicely but the second cup ended up being a little bitter from seeping so long and being pressed. I won't be making that mistake again.

The shop has super cute decorations and the place had a steady stream of customers the whole time we were there. I wouldn't mind stopping by this adorable and magical place again! I really want to try their gorgeous bingsoo.

DO NOT try the Nutella frappe taste like straight espresso as well as the Tiramisu snow dessert. Horrible...straight ice and espresso powder. Yucky! I took one bite and left it! It was disgusting. I wasted about $10!!!!

I LOVE shaved ice, and my favorite is the Japanese or Korean traditional style that comes with red beans and condensed milk. 

The ice here is unique and it tastes like an upgraded version of the ice-cream/snow that's on the market. I love how the flavor is infused into the ice. 

They offer vanilla or green tea shaved ice as their base. This place is hands down my favorite shaved ice place ever. 

They have specials, and right now it's tiramisu. I just can't seem to move on from the green tea though. 

Cool vibe and good stuff. For the die hard coffee fans, they've got Stumptown coffee, so that's a good motive to stop by. Yeah, I just said that as if I know how big of a deal Stumptown is, but really, I have no damn clue.

It was okay. They have an interesting menu of teas, coffee, and shave ice. Service was good, average prices,  & the place was clean.  Shave ice was good. I ordered a caramel apple latte and couldn't taste caramel or apple, which was disappointing.
This place has a great selection of frozen goodness, as well as teas and coffee, will definitely frequent this place while I'm here for wsop!

Bingsoo bingsoo, where have you been all my life?

This concept of shaved ice is delicious. Light and fluffy ice with powder/flavoring, toppings, and drizzle. I've had the chocolate one and the Oreo/cookies and creme one, both of which were amazing! The texture is great and the bowl is freezing cold so it doesn't melt fast. The portions are humungo! And yes people will say it's a bit pricey, but I think it's reasonable. It will fill you up so you definitely should bring a partner! The decor inside is also super cute and it's very clean. I wouldn't come here all the time because it is a pretty heavy and expensive dessert, but if I want to treat myself out to something special this is the place I'd go to. :)

Cute, but not so little, dessert spot on Jones (between Spring Mountain and Desert Inn Road, same plaza as District One). They serve their special "shaved" ice desserts, along with coffee and tea.

If you are not familiar with the plaza Snow White is located at, be warned that parking is always a problem for anyone visiting businesses in this plaza, especially at night. Carpooling is recommended if this is the after dinner dessert stop after a dinner outing with friends.

First of all Snow White did a fantastic job transforming that commercial space into a really delightful looking hanging out spot. The lighting in the evening is not too bright, which can even be considered romantic and completely suitable for extending the successful romantic dinner date at one of the many nearby restaurants.

Judging by their menu and promotional signage, their specialty is their selection of shaved ice (Bingsoo), which is prepared in a special machine which transformed a flavored liquid directly into tiny grains of ice chips that are fluffy, which is then topped of with their signature combination of toppings or the customer can elect to Design Your Own Snow. So instead of shaving previously frozen blocks of ice or flavored ice, their unique to all of Las Vegas MAGICAL machine conjures up fluffy snow to help stave back dangerous heat-related ailments in the perilous land of fire.

It would be so cool to see this MAGICAL transfiguration in action, but the young sorceress summoning my order of Tiramisu Shaved Ice guards their MAGICAL school's secret from us plain muggles and only expends her mana in the kitchen away from curious eyes.

It's okay though, the collective knowledge of the sages of Google extends even to the magic originating from the distant realm of Pusan (where Sung Hi Lee* and Girls Generation are from).  The wizards there have discovered, after thousands of hours of deep meditation, folding thousands of perfect paper cranes and mastery of Sudoku, how to turn any room temp or colder liquids (from beers, sodas, dairy, fruit juices) into tiny ice crystals in a matter of moments. It really is living up to their philosophy of "Be MAGICAL".

Although I have only had their MAGIC shaved ice, I plan to be back to give their Stumptown Cold Brew and Nitro Coffee a try.

Lastly beware of giants that may be roaming about, since even mystical dwarves are said to be the size of full grown muggles in this MAGICAL outpost of The Ice Queen.

Magic: 5/5
Ambiance: 5/5
Exchange Rate: 3/5

*If you are under the age of 17, set your preferred browser to "Maximum Innocent Pure As Drifting Snow" setting before looking up Sung Hi Lee. Failure to comply will result in activating the barrier charm that can only be broken by volunteering (100 hours x (17-(present age, if less than 17))) hours at the no kill animal shelters.

I was super torn with this place. I am a big fan of bingsoo. I like flavored shaved ice but I like plain shave ice with toppings much better. I just had the roasted soy bean shaved ice. It was really good! But the menu was kind of disappointing. I have never had to pay $11 for shaved ice before, its really expensive for frozen water and a few toppings. I highly suggest that they change their menu to be more customize-able, with having a base and choose what toppings you want, and what sauce. Their set menu is good too, but that should be the "suggested combos" not the only choices we have. The service was nice. The ambiance is very nice. The shaved ice was big enough to share with another person. Hopefully they add more toppings soon because I love this kind of shaved ice.

I like this cafe because it offers so many choices unlike other boba places that I have been too. They have  different kinds of shaved ice desserts, coffee and tea drinks. I will definitely come back here to try their snow cakes and colorful drinks.

Came here to study with friends a few days ago. It's a cute little spot in the plaza of district one and cafe Moda. 

The place was pretty much empty so we found a table right away and ordered some drinks. I ordered the watermelon slush. It was not too sweet but I was regretting not getting the lychee because that's my go to after taro. They didn't offer a taro slush which I would've gotten but the watermelon slush was still good. 

I like how their whole theme was around snow white and they had different decor around the place with snow white characters. The place isn't open as late as we usually study so that's a downside for us. 

Overall, this place was clean and offered free wifi which attracted us to the establishment in the first place. I would come here again to do more studying in the future.
